item.title: The Enduring Charm of El Cortez Hotel & Casino: A Vintage Las Vegas Landmark
item.description:
A Downtown Dynasty: The El Cortez Story

Las Vegas history is filled with iconic names and legendary spots, and nestled just a block from the dazzling Fremont Street Experience stands one of the most enduring: the El Cortez Hotel and Casino. Opened on November 7, 1941, by Guy McAfee, it wasn’t just another casino; it was a crucial piece of the developing Las Vegas landscape. Back then, Las Vegas wasnâ€™t the sprawling metropolis we know today. It was a dusty desert town slowly transforming into an entertainment destination, and the El Cortez, initially offering 48 rooms and a small casino, was right in the thick of it. Its location, close to Fremont Street (then the main drag!), made it a natural hub for early visitors.
